Text: Praise awaits You, O God, in Zion; to You our vows will be fulfilled.
Context: This introductory verse sets the tone for the psalm as a communal hymn of praise and gratitude toward God, possibly in a liturgical setting.

Text: O You who hear prayer, to You all men will come.
Context: The psalmist expresses confidence in God's readiness to hear prayer, conveying a sense of hope and expectation.

Text: When iniquities prevail against me, You atone for our transgressions.
Context: Despite the presence of sin and iniquity, the psalmist feels contentment in God's provision of atonement and forgiveness.

Text: Blessed is the one You choose and bring near to dwell in Your courts! We are filled with the goodness of Your house, the holiness of Your temple!
Context: An expression of the joy and privilege of being chosen by God to dwell in the divine presence, with no specific emotion towards the self, but a recognition of blessing.

Text: With awesome deeds of righteousness You answer us, O God of our salvation, the hope of all the ends of the earth and of the farthest seas.
Context: The psalmist acknowledges God's powerful and righteous acts with a sense of awe and reverence, underscoring God's role as the savior and hope of all the earth.

Text: Who established the mountains by His strength, being girded with might,
Context: An awe-inspired praise for God's creation of the mountains, reflecting on God's immense strength.

Text: who stills the roaring of the seas, the roaring of their waves, and the tumult of the nations.
Context: A calming notion that God has the power to bring peace to both nature (seas and waves) and the affairs of nations.

Text: The whole earth is filled with awe at Your wonders; where morning dawns and evening fades, You call forth songs of joy.
Context: Amazement at God's wonders that are observed throughout the natural cycle of day and night, suggesting continual divine creativity that elicits joy.

Text: You care for the land and water it; You enrich it abundantly. The streams of God are filled with water to provide the people with grain, for so You have ordained it.
Context: Gratitude and appreciation for God's providence and care in providing for the earth and its inhabitants, particularly through the provision of water and food.

Text: You drench its furrows and level its ridges; You soften it with showers and bless its growth.
Context: Joy and appreciation for the ways in which God prepares the earth for growth and fertility.

Text: You crown the year with Your bounty, and Your paths overflow with plenty.
Context: A grateful acknowledgement of the abundance and provisions that God bestows throughout the year.

Text: The pastures of the wilderness overflow; the hills are robed with joy.
Context: Contentment and satisfaction in witnessing the prosperous state of the land, with a poetic depiction of nature as being filled with joy.

Text: The meadows are clothed with flocks and the valleys are mantled with grain; they shout for joy and sing.
Context: Admiration for the prosperity and fertility of the land, with personification of the meadows and valleys expressing joy and praise.

Text: The rivers of God are filled with water to provide the people with grain, for so You have ordained it.
Context: Expresses joy and thankfulness for God's provision of water and grain, emphasizing the divine order and care in sustaining the people.
